back_cards.example_en: I have a dog named Max.
She had a great time at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To be obliged to do something.
back_cards.example_en: You have to finish your homework.
Let’s have lunch together.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate a relationship or association.
back_cards.example_en: They have a big family.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific thing or person previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: I like that shirt you’re wearing.
She said that she’d be late.
It was that moment that changed everything.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a distant object or idea.
back_cards.example_en: Look at that bird in the tree.

back_cards.definition_en: Connects ideas to show cause or purpose.
back_cards.example_en: I studied hard so that I could pass.
I’m saving money for a new car.
She’s been waiting for an hour.
This gift is for you.
I’m rooting for our team to win.
We’re heading for the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform or carry out an action.
back_cards.example_en: I need to do my laundry today.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to ask questions or form negatives.
back_cards.example_en: Do you like to swim?
She did her project last night.

back_cards.definition_en: To serve a purpose or function.
back_cards.example_en: This box will do for storage.
Just do it and stop complaining!

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male person previously mentioned.
back_cards.example_en: He went to the store for milk.
He always helps his neighbors.
I saw him at the game yesterday.
He was the hero of the story.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a male in a hypothetical situation.
back_cards.example_en: If he calls, let me know.
I went to the park with my friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Shows the means or tool used.
back_cards.example_en: She cut the paper with scissors.
He spoke with confidence.
She’s close with her sister.
The man with the hat is my dad.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicates position or location above something.
back_cards.example_en: The book is on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to a specific time or day.
back_cards.example_en: We’ll meet on Friday.
She’s working on a new project.
He gave a talk on climate change.
The light is on in the kitchen.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to something near or present.
back_cards.example_en: This coffee tastes amazing.
This is why I love hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: Points to a specific item or idea.
back_cards.example_en: Take this pen to write it down.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the current time or situation.
back_cards.example_en: This week has been so busy.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize a particular thing.
back_cards.example_en: This moment feels so special.
I can’t go to the party tonight.
She doesn’t like spicy food.
Don’t you want to come along?
You shouldn’t touch that wire.
There isn’t any milk left.

back_cards.definition_en: Refers to the speaker and others.
back_cards.example_en: We are going to the movies.
We finished the project together.
We need to talk about this.
We think this plan will work.
We had so much fun yesterday.
